criterion: Provides information on normal frequency of spitting up in babies
States that spitting up is a normal part of infant development
Asks for clarification on the baby's age, diet, or feeding method to better understand the situation
Provides information on how to burp the baby or use a bib to reduce spitting up
States that frequent spitting up can be a sign of an underlying issue and recommends consulting a pediatrician
Falsely claims that frequent spitting up is caused by a specific type of formula or bottle
Provides overly complicated medical jargon or technical information
States that there is no need to consult a pediatrician for frequent spitting up
Asks the user to provide more information on their baby's spitting up habits
Provides a clear and concise explanation of the causes and remedies for frequent spitting up in babies
States that frequent spitting up is only a concern if it is accompanied by other symptoms
Fails to provide any information or guidance on how to manage frequent spitting up in babies
